meanings.definition: A molecule that is a mirror image of another molecule.
meanings.sent1: In chemistry class, we learned about the enantiomer and its mirror image.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study enantiomers to understand their unique properties.
meanings.sent3: The enantiomer and its mirror image decided to have a reflection contest.
meanings.sent4: The enantiomer danced gracefully with its mirror image, perfectly mirroring each other's moves.
meanings.sent5: The enantiomer looked at its reflection and realized they were identical but opposite.

meanings.definition: One of a pair of optical isomers.
meanings.sent1: The lab technician carefully separated the enantiomer from its pair.
meanings.sent2: When synthesizing drugs, it is crucial to distinguish between enantiomers.
meanings.sent3: The enantiomer and its pair always argued about who was the better optical isomer.
meanings.sent4: The enantiomer stood out in the crowd, being the only optical isomer of its kind.
meanings.sent5: The enantiomer shone brightly among its optical isomer companions.
